lines.text: Well, is it fatal?
Indigestion? Only in Mexico.
[Halftime of final game]
Now, let's analyze what's been working for us.
[Long pause]

NOT A GOD DAMN THING'S been working for us. Like this goddamn suit doesn't work for me... and this stinking tie... and this goddamned shirt. IT DOESN'T WORK FOR ME. YOU KNOW HOW TO PLAY WINNING HARD-NOSED FOOTBALL? YOU PLAY FOOTBALL LIKE ED GENERRO PLAYED FOOTBALL. A guy who gave his life for this football team. He was a 140-pound halfback, and HE PLAYED LIKE A GODDAMN WILDMAN! NO! LIKE A GODDAMN RAMPAGING BEAST! And that's the way you got to do it! YOU GO OUT THERE! YOU TEAR THEIR FUCKING HEADS OFF, AND YOU SHIT DOWN THEIR NECKS! Let us pray.
You're hurt. You're tired. You're bleeding. I'm gonna make you a promise. We get into that endzone, you're not gonna feel any pain.
Welcome to football!
Welcome to foot... BALL!
[She kicks him in the crotch; he lets out a soprano wail]
[a racquetball that Suzanne hits ricochets and hits Paul in the head]
Oh my God, I'm sorry. Are you okay?
No, actually. I just got hit in the head by a racquetball.
Not much of a crowd.
Well, at least we have the home field advantage.
The Alamo was the home field.
[Popki hits a man during a bar brawl]
Hey Popki, you finally threw something that connected!
Dean Elias, for someone who hates football you sure spend alot of time watching the sport.
Eternal vigilance is the price of integrity, Coach Gennaro.

[quietly]
What an asshole.
[as Paul, who is 34 years old, approaches]
Wally, did you hire an Assistant Coach without telling me?
No, I found a Quarterback without telling you.
Well, I hope he gets younger as he gets closer.

Ok Banks. Ready, Hut! Come on, Banks, you're supposed to be hitting a sled, not humping a butterfly! I want you mean, I want you nasty! I want you to eat raw meat! Get your ass outta here! Alright, Next!

[as Andre readys himself to hit the blocking sled]
Ready, Hut!
[Andre knocks Coach Rig off the sled]
Andre does not eat raw meat. 'Cause Andre is a vegetarian.
Eat whatever the hell you want Andre!
If I wanted a big brother I wouldn't have killed mine.
I don't feel so good. I think I swallowed a finger.
The library's got your name on it. It's about time you saw the inside of it.
I don't wanna put any undue pressure on you guys, but Coach Gennero's last words were, win or I'll die.
I hope you stay tuned for our halftime extravaganza, as the Texas State marching band does its salute to gun racks and open beverage containers; which is only legal in Texas.
Now how could the ref call that? It was a clean kick to the face mask.

[after Lucy is brought in as the team's kicker]
Will ya look at that, they're putting a bloody Sheila on the team!
We'll be the laughing stock of college football.
What do you think we are now?
How many timeouts do we have left?
Three.
Can we take 'em all now?
[after a running play fails]
What happened, who missed their assignment?
Everybody missed their god-damn assignment!
I've been waiting for you!
You should be waiting for the guy that cut your hair!
Can I call ya Wally?
You can call me Walter.

[Dean Elias arrives at the bar and see's nothing is going on]
Sheriff, Im Dean Elias I heard about the brawl on my beeper. So where's the brawl?
Brawl? They ain't no brawl.
Number one There isn't any brawl. Number two what do you mean THEY AIN'T NO BRAWL!

[to Blake about Flat-top]
Mr. Blake. He'll never touch you.
[They clasp hands]
[Featherstone is unable to catch any pass thrown to him]
Keep your eyes on the ball, son.
I'd rather he kept his hands on the ball.
Holy Columbus Ohio!
[During an indoor practice, Popki's pass bounces off the rim of the basketball hoop]
How about that, he stinks at two sports.
I can work with him, just butt out of my offense.
If you can build an offense around a guy who throws like Edward Scissorhands, we're gonna be playing a hell of a lot of defense.
[During practice in the gym, Popki throws a wild pass that bounces off the rim of the basketball hoop]
How about that, he stinks at two sports.
I can work with him, just butt out of my offense.
If you can build an offense around a guy who throws like Edward Scissorhands, we're going to be playing a hell of alot of defense.
Get up, Wally, people are watching. Not many... but they're watching.
If this wasn't friggin astro-turf, I'd dig a grave for myself.
The Blake man pitches to Sarge, The Sargester bumps into his own man. It's a fumble! FUMBLAYA! Sargie "Fumblina" Wilkerson fumbles the ball!

[covers microphone]
SHIT!
Papke, what kind of defense are they using?
A double double.
A double... double, well it doesn't matter anyways.
Welcome to Billy Bob's. The only bar with its own indoor bull ridin' arena.
You alright?
Oh, I'm doing fine; except for the fact somebody hit me with a chair.
The next time I invite you out with the guys keep your white butt at home.
But I thought you said you wanted to Paaar-teee?
Hurts when they poke you in the chest like that?
Alright everyone, class over, get out.
Man! It's been a long time since I been able to kick some butt. See ya in class.
You got in all five W's; what, where, when, why and especially the who.
As in who gives a shit!
Gentlemen, this is your home field so please, take the ball.
Dean Elias is looking for any reason to bury us.
What are you doing here?
Well, I'm kinda bleeding in your doorway. Can I come in?
Sure. Didn't I tell you to wear a helmet?
Oh I'm sorry Jack, you're a genius; that's why you've got a bigger whistle than me.
Manu, snap me the ball.
SNAP THE BALL DAMN IT!
Manu, Manu hike me the ball.
[Manumana snaps the ball poorly]
Relax big guy; you've already got the job.
Wally call me crazy but I've got a funny feeling about tonight's game. Maybe we've got a shot.
[thunder sounds and clouds cover the sun]
But in a typhoon it's anybody's game.
Edison down at the Jayhawk 27. Although he did hydroplane to the 19.
Lucy Draper is the 1st woman football player in Armadillo history.
Listen, no speeches. I'm proud of you. Now let's get out of the typhoon.
We're consenting adults.
So were Bonnie and Clyde
I'm an Armadillo just like the others.
You're an Armadillo, but not like the others.
You're alright Manu.

[turns off radio]
I hate that station. My dad owns it. I don't want to see another building with his name on it.
You can't just walk away.
You did.
How did I end up with Jiminy Cricket?
Up yours Phil.
[walks away]
She called me Phil.
Hey guys, guys! Basic Losing is over.
He's in the endzone.
[pause]
I'm wating for a flag.
[pause]
There's no flag.
[pause]
There should be.
Ah hell, mabye we should think about blocking him tonight.
Linemen, you gotta give Blake at least four-god-damn-seconds to throw the ball.
Oh! Hello Boys.
[Elias is tackled by the teams]
By the way, you're fired.
Krimm breaks into the backfield. Fumble, FUMBALAYA, FUMBLERUSKI!

From Champs to chumps. Just six months ago, The Texas State Fighting Armadillos were billed as the greatest college football team in history, and now, they are history. Yesterday, the commision slapped Texas State with a staggering list of infractions including recruiting violations, steroid abuse, illegal payments to players and , of course, grade tampering. To where these guys are going, their yearbook photos will be used as mugshots. Joining us tonight is our guest commentator, the legendary Ed "Straight Arrow" Gennero, the man who once threw five All-Americans off his football team for taking money from boosters, but still won the Cotton Bowl. Thanks for joining us tonight, coach.
Good to be here, Chris.
Coach, what's the latest on the Armadillos?
Well, Chris, the penalty handed down to Texas State will set an example for the future of College Football.
What happened to the players?
All the players from the old team have been expelled and all the coaches have been fired.
Where will they get their new players?
Their new players must be real students. No more scholarships, no more monkey business, no more special favors or else no more football.

[over the campus loud speaker]
Hey Armadillo Fans! This is Chuck Neiderman. The voice of the Fighting Armadillo! This season your football team needs more than your support. So if any of you listener can punt, pass, block or kick, then report to the gymnasium at 3 o'clock sharp for open football tryouts.

[yelling at two students who quit at the tryout]
YOU CALL YOURSELF ARMADILLOS! THEN MOVE IT, YOU SORRY-ASS BUNCHES OF QUIVERING CIVILIAN SLIME!
[students leave as he addresses Coach Gennero]
Sir, we haven't had this many deserters in the Republican Guard.
Son, are you all that you can be?

[yelling]
SIR, YES SIR!
A little too much.

[softly]
Sir, Yes Sir.
Move It!
Sir, Yes Sir!
He's a coach, I'm a football player. The man can't talk to me like I'm human.
Have you tried?
I tried with you.
Look, you have to understand how hard it is to get resp...
Respect as a female teacher, yeah. You ought to try getting respect as a football player sometime.

[after McKenzie refused to wear pads, and was knocked unconscious by a tackle]
Look at that. He held onto the ball. Well, let's wake him up and get him some pads.
I don't know, Ed. Pads might hurt his game.
What's with all the attention?
Where I come from, Mr. Blake, we're taught to respect our elders.
Oh yeah? Well, I'm not that *eld*, alright?

[after Manumana's tackle]
BIIIIGGG sack by Manumana the Slender! Who does his "I'm gonna go out and get some POI" sack celebration dance!

[observing Lucy's kicking prowess]
Man, that is some foot!
Yeah, and it keeps getting better on the way up!

[upset]
HEY!
I'll buy you a beer. It's on me.

[dumping glass of beer on Blake]
Now it's on you.
I forgot. You're a genius. That's why you have a bigger whistle than I do.
I can't believe it. Now he has whistle-envy.

[visiting Gennero in hospital room]
Ed, it's me. Wally Riggendorf.
I know it's you. I'm not in a coma.

[hands bouquet]
I brought these for you.
Thank you. They're lovely.
I hope you don't mind - I had to charge them to your room. I'm a little short this week.
I understand, Wally. Will you sit down? I want to talk to you.
I'm here, Ed. I'm here.
You don't have to talk like I'm dying! They're just running some tests. They haven't found anything yet.
That's wonderful news.

[hands Wally binder]
I want you to have this, Wally.

[emotionally]
Your playbook. I don't know what to say. I'll cherish it - always.
I'm not bequeathing it to you! I'm just loaning it to you. You're coaching the team tonight.

[hands Wally his whistle]
You can do it, Wally. Just be yourself.
The big whistle...
A 94-yard kickoff return for a touchdown could give the Colts a false sense of confidence going into the second minute of play.
